content.description: This is a fairly steep climb at the start on great holds. A little bit of choss factor, a jumbled landing, and a poorly placed tree take away a little from the overall quality but the moves are good nonetheless.
content.protection: 2 crashpads, a spotter could increase the comfort factor. A number of big rocks and tree branches occupy the LZ.
content.location: On the west face overlooking the streambed. Not much explanation needed, it’s  the obvious line of pockets climbing out the overhang. SDS using the hueco at the bottom and climb straight up.

content.description: This is the obvious and most attractive line on the first face seen when approaching this boulder.
content.location: SDS on the trail side face between a small square boulder and a tree. The start holds are a LH sidepull and RH sidepull/undercling. Link to the upper part of the boulder using a good incut and a fairly good sloper. As the angle changes to vertical climb to the top using crimps to sneak past loose rock on the left and right.

content.description: A large rounded boulder with several overhanging faces. The rock quality on this one is more variable than   some of the nearby boulders and the landings are more jumbled.
